meanings.definition: A citadel or fortified part of an ancient Greek city, typically built on a hill.
meanings.sent1: The ancient acropolis overlooked the entire city.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often visit the acropolis to learn about ancient history.
meanings.sent3: The acropolis seemed to be playing hide and seek with the clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an acropolis, guarded and impenetrable.
meanings.sent5: The acropolis stood tall like a silent guardian of the past.

meanings.definition: The upper fortified part of an ancient Greek city.
meanings.sent1: From the acropolis, one could see far into the distance.
meanings.sent2: The acropolis was the heart of the ancient city's defense.
meanings.sent3: The acropolis looked down on the bustling city below with a sense of superiority.
meanings.sent4: His determination was an acropolis, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The acropolis gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon of ancient power.
